Posted By: Gelzo (9/23/2011 8:35:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: So many card's in this set rely on sacrificing, or otherwise putting your own creatures into your graveyard that there's a good chance that your opponent will set up the morbid condition for you, without you having to use any additional cards. It's very disappointing to sacrifice a creature to [Stitcher's Apprentice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stitcher's Apprentice) in order to have a creature to exile for [Stitched Drake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stitched Drake) just to have it destroyed by Brimstone Volley. At least I still had my Homunculus Token (I wish I could Auto-Card to it).
posts.html:

Posted By: MarilynMonroe (10/6/2011 11:44:56 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At first, I looked at this and though, "Meh, too much like [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe) with a condition." And then I realized that [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe) doesn't suck because it deals five damage, it sucks because it deals five damage, costs 5, is a sorcery, and can only target creatures.  
  
I don't see Morbid as too difficult to activate in burn decks, especially with plenty of weak utility creatures running around out there. Burn away one with a [Geistflame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Geistflame) or [Chandra, the Firebrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra, the Firebrand) or 2-for-1 with an [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail), then drop 5 damage on your opponent's [Steel Hellkite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Steel Hellkite) (or on their face). Probably not going to be a 4-of by any means, since it's competing with plenty of strong burn like [Volt Charge](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volt Charge), [Arc Trail](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Arc Trail), and [Shrine of Burning Rage](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shrine of Burning Rage), but in a creature-rich meta, this is huge value for a common.
posts.html:
At first, I looked at this and though, "Meh, too much like Lava Axe with a condition." And then I realized that Lava Axe doesn't suck because it deals five damage, it sucks because it deals five damage, costs 5, is a sorcery, and can only target creatures.

I don't see Morbid as too difficult to activate in burn decks, especially with plenty of weak utility creatures running around out there. Burn away one with a Geistflame or Chandra, the Firebrand or 2-for-1 with an Arc Trail, then drop 5 damage on your opponent's Steel Hellkite (or on their face). Probably not going to be a 4-of by any means, since it's competing with plenty of strong burn like Volt Charge, Arc Trail, and Shrine of Burning Rage, but in a creature-rich meta, this is huge value for a common.

posts.post_content: This is the kind of card that you'll be hearing about for a long time. Five damage wherever you need it for three mana (and an incredibly easy trigger) is an incredible value. Posted By: SkaerKrow (10/31/2011 8:52:51 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like this card. It's a strong finisher. You attack with your team into whatever he has, for example, your [Chandra's Phoenix](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra's Phoenix) and [Stormblood Berserker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stormblood Berserker) hit for 5 but he blocks your [Grim Lavamancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Grim Lavamancer) who dies. He thought he was going to be dropping to five, but the volley wins.
  
   
Being an instant adds versatility too as you can sneak in five damage out of nowhere after some combat or removal.
posts.html:

Being an instant adds versatility too as you can sneak in five damage out of nowhere after some combat or removal.

posts.post_content:
Does it check if a creature died during casting or resolution? As in this situation:
  
No creatures have died this turn yet. I'm attacking with my [Chandra's Spitfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra's Spitfire) and cast this. In response to it, my opponent plays [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) and kills my Spitfire.
  
Does it it deal 3 damage (as no creatures had died when it was cast) or 5 (as a creature had died when it resolved)?
  
   
...Not that it affects it playability much, I just thought of using it during a combat trick and I'm not sure how it would work out.
  
Still, seems pretty solid - 5 damage for 3 mana at instant speed is enough for me to bear a slight condition. Even without morbid it isn't useless. Reminds me of [Cackling Flames](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cackling Flames), except generally better.
posts.html:

Still, seems pretty solid - 5 damage for 3 mana at instant speed is enough for me to bear a slight condition. Even without morbid it isn't useless. Reminds me of Cackling Flames, except generally better.

T3: [Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain), [Goblin Chieftan](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Chieftan), Swing for 6
